questions.question: Question 1: Which of the following is not a natural estrogen?
questions.explanation: Ethinylestradiol is a synthetic estrogen. Natural estrogens are: • Estradiol • Estriol • Estrone

questions.question:
Question 2: A 55-year-old postmenopausal lady is on estrogen as part of her hormone replacement 
therapy. Which of the following statements about estrogen is not true?
questions.explanation:
Estrogen causes an increase in plasma HDL levels. Estrogen also causes an increase in triglycerides, apolipoprotein levels, and an increase in the 
turnover of LDL receptors.

questions.question:
Question 3: A post-menopausal lady who is on estrogen therapy for hot flashes is concerned about its 
adverse effects. She is not at an increased risk of developing which of the following cancers?
questions.explanation:
Women receiving estrogen therapy do not have an increased risk of developing gall bladder 
carcinoma. Long-term estrogen therapy can increase the risk of gall stones. Although gall stones can be 
associated with the development of gall bladder carcinoma, there is no direct correlation between 
long term estrogen therapy and gall bladder carcinoma. Estrogen therapy has been associated with breast, endometrial and hepatocellular carcinoma. 680 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question: Question 4: In which of the following conditions is hormone replacement therapy not helpful?
questions.explanation:
Hormone replacement therapy(HRT) is not helpful in coronary heart disease. Progesterone used in the HRT is associated with an increased risk of coronary artery disease, 
thromboembolism, and related mortality. Estrogens promote coagulation and thromboembolic 
episodes. Options A and B: Estrogen is helpful in flushing and local preparations are preferred for vaginal 
atrophy. Option D: Estrogen is beneficial for osteoporosis if it is started before the onset of significant 
osteoporosis. Note: The use of HRT for cardiovascular benefits is quite controversial. The current consensus is 
that the HRT should be started only after assessing the benefit/risk profile individually and is not 
indicated for the prevention of cardiovascular events in all menopausal women as it was 
previously advocated.

questions.question:
Question 5: Progestin dose remains constant throughout the cycle in which of the following type of 
combined contraceptive pills?
questions.explanation:
Monophasic pills contain constant amounts of progesterone and estrogen that is taken daily for 21 
days, followed by a 7-day pill-free period. Biphasic and triphasic pills have variable amounts of active ingredients (especially progesterone) 
that mimic the natural changes in the hormonal levels in the menstrual cycle. These pills reduce 
the total amount of steroids that needs to be administered.

questions.question:
Question 6: A young lady who is on oral contraceptive pills refrains from taking any drug even for minor 
ailments due to the fear of contraceptive failure. Which of the following drugs can be taken 
safely?
questions.explanation:
Among the given drugs, aspirin use is least likely to cause contraceptive failure. Option B: Broad-spectrum antibiotics like tetracycline suppress the intestinal flora and interfere 
with the enterohepatic circulation of estrogen. This leads to lowering of plasma estrogen levels 
and can result in contraceptive failure. Options C and D: Enzyme inducers like phenytoin and rifampicin increase the metabolism of oral 
contraceptives and can cause contraceptive failure.

questions.question:
Question 7: A 23-year-old lady has been on anti-epileptic therapy since childhood and now comes to the 
OPD seeking advice on a suitable method of contraception. Which contraceptive method 
should be avoided in her?
questions.explanation:
Oral contraceptives must be avoided or used cautiously in epilepsy. The most important aspect to consider is the drug interactions between anti-epileptic drugs and 
contraceptives. There is no conclusive evidence on whether estrogen is beneficial or harmful for 681 
Sold by @itachibot seizure control. Note: Convulsive disorder is not an absolute contraindication; it is safe to avoid but can be used 
with caution.

questions.question:
Question 8: 673 
Sold by @itachibot Which of the following statements about oral contraceptive pills is true?

options.b: It is protective against ovarian cancer
options.c: OCP are used in treatment mastalgia
options.d: Rifamipicin decreases the metabolism of OCP

questions.explanation:
Oral contraceptive pills (OCP) protect against ovarian cancer. This benefit is thought to be due to the prolonged suppression of gonadotropin stimulation of the 
ovary on long-term use of OCPs. Other benefits of oral contraceptive pills: • Lesser incidence of endometrial carcinoma due to progestin component in OCP • Regularisation of menstrual cycles results in relief of dysmenorrhea and menorrhagia • Reduced incidence of fibrocystic breast disease and ovarian cysts • Endometriosis and pelvic inflammatory disease are improved Option A: The estrogen component of combined oral contraceptive pills is mainly responsible for 
venous thromboembolism. Option C: OCP is not used in the treatment of mastalgia. Mastalgia, chloasma, and breakthrough 
bleeding are known side effects of oral contraceptive pills. Option D: OCPs are metabolized by CYP3A4 enzymes. Rifampicin is a strong inducer of CYP3A4. 
Hence, if administered together, rifampicin can cause enhanced metabolism of OCPs and may 
lead to contraceptive failure.

questions.question:
Question 9: A 23-year-old lady on oral combined contraceptive pills misses a single dose and reports to 
you in the OPD the next morning. What will be the most appropriate advice to this patient?

options.a: Continue taking the next dose as scheduled
options.b: Double the next dose to make up for the missed dose
options.c: Interrupt the course and start taking the medications again on 5th day of bleeding
options.d: Start a fresh course of OCP again

questions.explanation:
The most appropriate advice for this patient who has missed a single dose of the oral 
contraceptive pill (OCP) is to double the next dose to make up for the missed dose. Missed dose considerations for oral combined contraceptive pills: • If a single dose is missed - a double dose can be taken on the next day to make up for the missed 
dose. • If two or more doses are missed on subsequent days - the last missed pill has to be taken along 
with the present pill and alternative methods of contraceptive must be used for the next 7 days. • If the pills were missed on the last week (days 15-21) - omit the hormone-free interval by 
finishing the hormonal pills in the current pack and starting the new pack from the next day.

questions.question:
Question 10: In which of the following patients is combined oral contraceptive pills not absolutely 
contraindicated?

options.a: A perimenopausal woman with coronary heart disease
options.b: A 23-year-old lady with a past history of hepatic adenoma
options.c: A multiparous lady with abnormal undiagnosed vaginal bleeding

questions.explanation:
682 
Sold by @itachibot A migraine headache is a relative contraindication for the use of combined oral contraceptives. 
Migraine with focal neurological symptoms is an absolute contraindication to combined oral 
contraceptive use. Absolute contraindications to combined oral contraceptive use: • Presence or history of thromboembolic disease, cerebrovascular disease, myocardial infarction, 
coronary artery disease • Congenital hyperlipidemia • Known or suspected carcinoma of the breast, female reproductive tract • Known or suspected pregnancy • Past or present liver tumors or impaired liver function • Undiagnosed vaginal bleeding. • Migraine with focal neurological symptoms Relative contraindications to combined oral contraceptive use: • Migraine headaches in >35 yrs female • Hypertension • Diabetes mellitus • Obstructive jaundice of pregnancy • Prior oral contraceptive use • Gallbladder disease

questions.question: Question 11: Progestin-only pills do not act by which of the following mechanisms?

options.d: Eliciting an inflammatory action in the endometrium

questions.explanation:
Copper intrauterine devices elicit an inflammatory reaction within the endometrium. This impairs 
sperm viability, motility, and fertilization. All the following actions contribute to the contraceptive action of progestin-only pills: • The effectiveness of this drug is largely due to the thickening of cervical mucus which in turn 
impair sperm penetration. • Inhibits ovulation via exerting negative feedback on the hypothalamus (GnRH). This leads to the 
absence of the FSH and LH surge, which is essential to mature the dominant follicle and trigger 
ovulation. • Interfere with the implantation of a zygote by altering the endometrial environment. The major reason women discontinue the use of progestin-only contraceptives is breakthrough 
bleeding.

questions.question:
Question 12: 674 
Sold by @itachibot A 35-year-old lady, P2L2, has been taking depot medroxy progesterone acetate as a 
contraceptive. Which of the following best describes the formulation?
questions.explanation:
683 
Sold by @itachibot Depot medroxyprogesterone acetate (DMPA) is a long-acting progestin-only injection formulation. DMPA is administered every 3 months intramuscularly as a contraceptive.

questions.question: Question 13: Which of the following progesterone is used in emergency contraception?
questions.explanation:
Levonorgestrel is the progesterone that is used in emergency contraception. 
Levonorgestrel-containing regimens are considered the standard regimen now. Option B: Micronised progesterone is indicated for amenorrhea and to counteract estrogen effects 
on the uterus. Option C: Norgesterone is usually used along with ethinyl estradiol for regular contraception. Option D: Depot medroxyprogesterone acetate is a long-acting depot preparation indicated for 
long-term contraception.

questions.question:
Question 14: A newly married couple came to the OPD saying that they had unprotected intercourse two 
days back but are not desiring a baby at present. Which of the following drugs can be 
prescribed in this case?
questions.explanation:
Ulipristal is a selective progesterone receptor modulator (SPRM) that can be given as an 
emergency contraceptive in this case. It should be administered within 5 days of unprotected intercourse. It inhibits ovulation by suppressing LH surge as well as by direct effect on follicular rupture. In 
addition, its action on the endometrium can interfere with implantation.

questions.question:
Question 15: The standard emergency contraceptive pill regimen, levonorgestrel can be taken up to how 
many hours after unprotected intercourse?
questions.explanation:
Levonorgestrel regimen can be taken within 72 hours after unprotected intercourse but is most 
effective when taken as early as possible. Levonorgestrel for emergency contraception can be taken as either of the following: • 2 tablets of 0.75 mg 12 hours apart • 1.5 mg single-dose

questions.question:
Question 16: A 20-year old lady came to the OPD with complaints of missed period. You diagnose her to be 
5 weeks pregnant but she is not willing to continue the pregnancy. You decide to prescribe 
her a drug that has anti-progestational activity. Which of the following drugs would you 
choose?
questions.explanation:
Mifepristone (RU-486) has potent anti-progestational (abortive activity) and significant 
anti-glucocorticoid and antiandrogenic activity. Options A and B: Levonorgestrel and desogestrel are progesterone preparations. Option C: Misoprostol is a synthetic prostaglandin (PGE1) preparation. 684 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question: Question 17: In the treatment of which of the following patients will you not consider clomiphene citrate?

options.b: A 48-year old perimenopausal woman with hot flashes

questions.explanation:
Clomiphene citrate is not used in the treatment of hot flashes. Option A- Clomiphene increases gonadotropin secretion and stimulates ovulation. It mainly acts 
by blocking the inhibitory actions of estrogen on gonadotropin release from the pituitary gland. It 
is primarily indicated in the management of infertility. Option C - In men also, clomiphene increases gonadotropin secretion and promotes 
spermatogenesis. However, success rates are low. Option D - Studies have shown clomiphene citrate to be effective in treating and preventing 
short-lasting unilateral neuralgiform headache attacks (SUNCT). It has not yet been 
FDA-approved for the treatment of SUNCT.

questions.question:
Question 18: A 45-year-old lady, diagnosed with breast cancer, is started on a selective estrogen receptor 
modulator. Identify the drug.
questions.explanation:
Raloxifene is a selective estrogen receptor modulator. It has agonist action on bone and antagonist action on the breast and uterus. It is used in the treatment and prevention of osteoporosis and in breast cancer prevention in 
high-risk postmenopausal women.

questions.question:
Question 19: A 60-year-old lady who is on tamoxifen, for the treatment of breast cancer is worried about 
its side effects. Which of the following side effects of tamoxifen is least likely to occur in this 
patient?
questions.explanation:
Tamoxifen acts as an estrogen receptor antagonist in breast tissues. The use of tamoxifen in 
carcinoma of breast patients decreases the incidence of carcinoma in opposite breasts. The estrogen agonistic action of tamoxifen and its consequences are: • Uterine endometrium - endometrial hypertrophy, vaginal bleeding, and endometrial cancer • Coagulation system - thromboembolism leading to pulmonary embolism (tamoxifen decreases 
the level of antithrombin III and protein C in the blood) • Bone metabolism - increase in bone mineral density • Liver - alterations of blood lipid profile • Cataract

questions.question: Question 20: Which of the following is a selective estrogen receptor down regulator?
questions.explanation:
Fulvestrant is a selective estrogen receptor down-regulator. It does not have estrogen agonistic 
activity for any tissue and is regarded as a pure estrogen antagonist. 685 
Sold by @itachibot Tamoxifen, toremifene, and raloxifene are selective estrogen receptor modulators with the agonist 
or antagonist action at different tissues.

questions.question: Question 21: Which of the following is an aromatase inhibitor?
questions.explanation:
Exemestane is an aromatase inhibitor. Estrogen is locally produced from androgen by the action of the aromatase enzyme. Locally 
synthesized estrogens play an important role in the development of breast cancer because they are 
estrogen-dependent for proliferation. Aromatase inhibitors decrease estrogen synthesis and are widely used now in the treatment of 
breast cancer in postmenopausal women. Aromatase inhibitors are: • Letrozole • Anastrozole • Exemestane (Irreversible inhibitor)

questions.question:
Question 22: You decide to change the chemotherapeutic regimen of a patient with breast cancer from 
tamoxifen to an aromatase inhibitor. Which of the following is not an advantage of the latter 
in the treatment of breast cancer?

options.a: No increase in risk of venous thromboembolism
options.b: No increase in risk of endometrial cancer
options.c: Can be used in advanced cases which are tamoxifen-resistant

questions.explanation:
Aromatase inhibitors lack the property of maintaining bone mineral density when compared to 
tamoxifen. Aromatase inhibitors dramatically reduce estrogen levels that result in a decrease in the risk of 
venous thromboembolism and also decreases the risk of endometrial hyperplasia/cancer. It is also 
indicated in tamoxifen-resistant advanced breast cancer.

questions.question: Question 23: Yuzpe's regimen of emergency contraception consists of which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Yuzpe's regimen of emergency contraception consists of a combination of levonorgestrel and 
ethinylestradiol. The regimen includes two doses at 12 hours intervals within 72 hours of unprotected intercourse. 
It has a higher incidence of nausea and vomiting and is less efficacious than progesterone only 
standard regimen. Methods of Emergency contraception: Drug 
Dose Levonorgestrel 
0.75mg stat and after 12 hour

questions.question:
Question 24: You are an intern posted in the medicine ward and you notice the given dermatological 
finding in a patient with abdominal distension. Which of the following hormones is 
implicated in this finding?
questions.explanation:
The image shown is of spider nevus and the hormone implicated in its development is estrogen. It is commonly seen in hyperestrogenic states such as pregnancy and in those taking 
estrogen-containing contraceptives. It can also be seen in male patients with cirrhosis due to the 
decreased ability of the liver to metabolize circulating estrogens, specifically estrone, which 
derives from the androgen androstenedione. Estrogens cause blood vessels to enlarge and dilate.

questions.question:
Question 25: A 28-year-old man presents to the OPD with the following condition. Which of the following 
drugs can cause this adverse effect? 678 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation:
This is a case of gynecomastia which can occur as an adverse effect of spironolactone or 
ketoconazole or chlorpromazine. Spironolactone - decreases testosterone production, increases peripheral conversion of 
testosterone to estradiol, and displaces estradiol from their plasma-protein-binding sites Ketoconazole - decreases testosterone production and displaces testosterone from their binding 
sites Chlorpromazine (neuroleptics) - increase prolactin release by blocking the inhibitory action of 
dopamine on prolactin Clomiphene and tamoxifen are used mainly in reducing male gynecomastia. 687 
Sold by @itachibot Androgens and Drugs for Erectile Dysfunction
